intro: Urera crassifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed urera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for tropical gardens and conservation efforts.
